intro: Piperia longispica, commonly known as the long-spurred piperia, is a herbaceous plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white flowers arranged in umbels, which are typical of the carrot family. Its fruit is a dry, two-lobed schizocarp, releasing small, wind-dispersed seeds. Native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere, it thrives in moist, shaded environments.
